Spanish: Conforme surge de las imágenes infrarrojas, las variaciones de temperatura durante la noche y el día indican que, probablemente, se trate de cuevas.
English:
output: Infrared images show that the temperature variations from night and day show that they are likely caves.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Durante el día, su temperatura es más baja que la de la superficie que la rodea y, por las noches, más alta.
English:
output: "They are cooler than the surrounding surface in the day and warmer at night.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: «Si bien su comportamiento térmico no es tan regular como las grandes cuevas en nuestro planeta, que suelen sostener una temperatura bastante estable, es consistente con estas profundas cavidades en el suelo», sostuvo Glen Cushing, del equipo de arqueología del Servicio Geológico Estadounidense (USGS) y de la Universidad del Norte de Arizona, en Flagstaff, Arizona.
English:
output: Their thermal behavior is not as steady as large caves on Earth that often maintain a fairly constant temperature, but it is consistent with these being deep holes in the ground," said Glen Cushing of the United States Geological Survey (USGS) Astrogeology Team and of Northern Arizona University located in Flagstaff, Arizona.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: En Francia, las elecciones han sido tradicionalmente una experiencia poco tecnológica: los votantes se aíslan en un cubículo e introducen en un sobre una hoja preimpresa que indica el candidato que han elegido.
English:
output: In France, voting has traditionally been a low-tech experience: voters isolate themselves in a booth, put a pre-printed sheet of paper indicating their candidate of choice into an envelope.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Luego de que los funcionarios corroboran la identidad quien se presenta a votar, éste ingresa el sobre en la urna y firma el listado de votantes.
English:
output: After officials verify the voter's identity, the voter drops the envelope into the ballot box and signs the voting roll.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: La ley electoral francesa establece los procedimientos de forma bastante estricta.
English:
output: French electoral law rather strictly codifies the proceedings.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Desde 1988, las urnas tienen que ser transparentes, lo que permite a los electores y observadores verificar que no haya sobres al comienzo del sufragio y que no se agregan otros que no sean los de quienes votan, debidamente computados y autorizados.
English:
output: Since 1988, ballot boxes must be transparent so that voters and observers can witness that no envelopes are present at the start of the vote and that no envelopes are added except those of the duly counted and authorized voters.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Los candidatos tienen la facultad de enviar representantes para controlar cada etapa del proceso y, durante la noche, los voluntarios computan los votos bajo una rigurosa supervisión y de conformidad con procedimientos específicos.
English:
output: Candidates can send representatives to witness every part of the process. In the evening, votes are counted by volunteers under heavy supervision, following specific procedures.

instruction:

instruction:

output: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice.

instruction:

output: The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: El número de iones de hidrógeno (la H en pH) presentes en el producto químico analizado determina su nivel de pH.
English:
output: The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Los átomos de hidrógeno están formados por un protón y un electrón. Por ello, un ion de hidrógeno es el resultado de despojar a un protón de su electrón.

output: Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

instruction:

instruction:

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Las ciudades de Harappa y Mohenjo-daro tenían inodoros con descarga en casi todas las casas, los que se conectaban con un sistema de desagüe sofisticado.
English:
output: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system.

instruction:

English:
output: Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: También contaban con sanitarios en el antiguo Egipto, Persia y China. En la civilización romana, los baños públicos tenían retretes y algunos eran compartidos por hombres y mujeres.
English:
output: There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Cuando uno se comunica con alguien que está a miles de millas de distancia, se está haciendo uso de un satélite.
English:
output: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: El satélite en el espacio recibe la llamada y, luego, la refleja de vuelta casi de forma instantánea.
English:
output: The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: El satélite fue enviado al espacio a través de un cohete. Los científicos utilizan telescopios en el espacio, dado que la luz de la atmósfera de la Terra distorsiona parte de la luz y vista que tenemos.
English:
output: The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Se precisa un cohete gigante, de más de 100 pies de altura, para poder llevar un satélite o telescopio al espacio exterior.
English:
output: It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: La rueda ha modificado al mundo de formas sorprendentes. Lo más relevante que ha hecho por nosotros fue brindarnos un transporte mucho más simple y veloz.
English:
output: The wheel has changed the world in incredible ways. The biggest thing that the wheel has done for us is given us much easier and faster transportation.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Gracias a ella hoy tenemos muchos medios de transporte, como el ferrocarril o el automóvil, entre tantos otros.
English:
output: It has brought us the train, the car, and many other transportation devices.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Por debajo, existen felinos de tamaño más moderado que se alimentan de presas medianas, desde conejos hasta antílopes y ciervos.
English:
output: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Finalmente, existen muchos felinos pequeños (que incluyen a los gatos domésticos independientes) que se alimentan de especies de poco tamaño que existen en mucha más cantidad, como insectos, roedores, lagartijas y aves.
English:
output: Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: El secreto de su éxito es el concepto de nicho: cada felino tiene una función particular, que evita que compita con otros.
English:
output: The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Los leones son los felinos que más socializan y su vida transcurre dentro de grupos de gran tamaño denominados manadas.
English:
output: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Las manadas están formadas por uno a tres machos adultos del mismo grupo familiar, unidos con hasta treinta hembras y sus crías.
English:
output: Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Por lo general, las hembras se relacionan estrechamente entre sí, lo que las hace una gran familia de hermanas e hijas.
English:
output: The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Las manadas de leones tienen el mismo comportamiento que las de los lobos o los perros, con quienes guardan una sorprendente similitud (a diferencia de los otros grandes felinos) tanto en su conducta como en que son altamente letales para sus presas.
English:
output: Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Atleta integral, el tigre tiene la habilidad de trepar (pero no demasiado bien), nadar, dar extensos saltos y jalar cinco veces más fuerte que una persona robusta.
English:
output: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: El tigre es del mismo género (Panthera) que los leones, leopardos y jaguares. Estos son los únicos cuatro felinos capaces de emitir rugidos.
English:
output: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: El del tigre no es un rugido plenamente sonoro como el del león, sino, antes bien, como una oración de palabras dichas a gruñidos y a los gritos.
English:
output: The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Los ocelotes disfrutan alimentarse de criaturas pequeñas. En lo posible, cazarán monos, serpientes, roedores y aves. Casi todas sus presas tendrán un tamaño muy inferior al suyo.
English:
output: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Los científicos creen que los ocelotes rastrean y encuentran animales para comer (presas) a través del olfato, oliendo el suelo donde han pasado.
English:
output: Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Tienen muy buena visión nocturna y en lugares oscuros y, además, se desplazan muy sigilosamente. Los ocelotes cazan a sus presas mimetizándose con su entorno y luego se abalanzan sobre ellas.
English:
output: They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Cuando un grupo reducido de seres vivos (una población pequeña) se aparta de la principal de la que provienen (por ejemplo, si se desplazan a una cadena montañosa o a un río, o si se trasladan a una isla nueva de modo que no pueden retroceder con facilidad) se encontrarán, con frecuencia, en un ambiente diferente al que solían estar acostumbrados.
English:
output: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: El nuevo entorno cuenta con distintos recursos y competidores y, por lo tanto, una nueva población necesitará características o adaptaciones diferentes de las que tenía antes para ser un competidor fuerte.
English:
output: This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: No se han producido cambios en la población original, que aún precisan de las mismas adaptaciones que en el pasado.
English:
output: The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Al pasar el tiempo, a medida que la incipiente población se va adaptando al nuevo entorno, comienza a asemejarse cada vez menos a la otra población.
English:
output: Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Finalmente, tras miles o, incluso, millones de años, las dos poblaciones lucirán tan distintas que no será posible catalogarlas como de la misma especie.
English:
output: Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Este proceso recibe el nombre de especiación, que simplemente significa el desarrollo de especies nuevas, y es una consecuencia ineludible y parte fundamental de la evolución.
English:
output: We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Las plantas generan el oxígeno que las personas respiran y absorben el dióxido de carbono que ellas exhalan (que despiden).
English:
output: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out).

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: El alimento de las plantas se genera con la energía solar, gracias a la fotosíntesis. Además, ellas nos ofrecen sombra.

output: Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Construimos nuestras casas a partir de las plantas y con ellas también fabricamos ropa. La mayoría de los alimentos que ingerimos son plantas. Sin ellas, los animales no sobrevivirían.
English:
output: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: El Mosasaurus fue el depredador alfa de su época, por tanto, a nada le temía, excepto a otros de su misma especie.
English:
output: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Sus largas mandíbulas tenían incrustados más de 70 dientes afilados como navajas, además de otro grupo adicional en el paladar, lo que se traduce en que cualquier cosa que le pasara por delante, no tenía escapatoria.
English:
output: Its long jaws were studded with more than 70 razor-sharp teeth, along with an extra set in the roof of its mouth, meaning that there was no escape for anything that crossed its path.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: No tenemos la seguridad, pero podría haber tenido la viperina. Su dieta incluía tortugas, peces grandes, otros mosasáuridos e, incluso, podría haber sido un caníbal.
English:
output: We don't know for sure, but it may have had a forked tongue. Its diet included turtles, large fish, other mosasaurs, and it may even have been a cannibal.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Atacaba también a cualquier criatura que entrara en el agua: ni siquiera un dinosaurio tan enorme como el T. Rex era una amenaza para él.
English:
output: It also attacked anything that entered the water; even a giant dinosaur such as T. rex would be no match for it.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Si bien la mayoría de esa comida nos resultaría bastante familiar, los romanos comían también ciertos artículos poco convencionales en los banquetes, como jabalíes, pavos reales, caracoles y hasta un tipo de roedor, el lirón.
English:
output: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Otra cosa en la que se diferenciaban era que la gente humilde y las mujeres comían sentados en una silla, mientras que los acaudalados disfrutaban de compartir banquetes y echarse de lado mientras comían.
English:
output: Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: No es posible que las recetas de la antigua Roma incluyeran alimentos que llegaron a Europa desde América o Asia siglos después.
English:
output: Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Verbigracia, no tenían maíz, ni tomates, ni patatas, ni cacao y ningún romano de la antigüedad degustó un pavo alguna vez.
English:
output: For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Los babilonios edificaron para cada uno de sus dioses un templo central considerado su hogar.
English:
output: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Las personas llevaban sacrificios para los dioses y los sacerdotes procuraban satisfacer las necesidades de aquellos celebrando ceremonias y festivales.
English:
output: People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals.

instruction:

Spanish: Los templos tienen un patio abierto y a continuación un santuario interno al que solo podían ingresar los sacerdotes.
English:
output: Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter.

instruction:

Spanish: En ocasiones, se edificaban torres especiales con forma piramidal, denominadas zigurats, para que formasen parte de los templos.

output: Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: La parte superior de la torre constituía un santuario especial para su deidad.
English:
output: The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: En medio del cálido clima del Oriente Medio, la casa no era de mayor importancia.
English:
output: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Las familias hebreas pasaban la mayor parte de su tiempo al aire libre.
English:
output: Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Las mujeres cocinaban en el patio; las tiendas eran tan solo mostradores que daban a la calle. Las casas se construían con piedra.
English:
output: Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: En la tierra de Canaán no había bosques grandes; por ello, la madera era extremadamente costosa.
English:
output: There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Muy pocos habitantes vivían en Groenlandia. Según las sagas nórdicas, Erik el Rojo fue exiliado de Islandia por homicidio y, durante un viaje que emprendió más hacia el oeste, descubrió la isla y le dio su nombre.
English:
output: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Aun así, sin perjuicio de su descubrimiento, las tribus esquimales ya habitaban el lugar para ese entonces.
English:
output: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Si bien cada país por separado era «escandinavo», existían marcadas diferencias en relación al pueblo, los monarcas, los hábitos y la historia entre Dinamarca, Suecia, Noruega e Islandia.
English:
output: Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: Si ha visto el filme Tesoro Nacional, quizás crea que un mapa del tesoro fue trazado en el dorso de la Declaración de la Independencia.
English:
output: If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: No obstante, eso no es cierto. Si bien el reverso del documento contiene algo escrito, no se trata de un mapa de un tesoro.
English:
output: However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map.

instruction:
Translate the following Spanish source text to English:
Spanish: La Declaración de la Independencia tiene escrito en su reverso la frase «Declaración de Independencia original del 4 de julio de 1776». El texto figura en la parte inferior del documento, boca abajo.
English:
output: Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down.
